description: The most common format, usually seen when you navigate to a video from within YouTube's website.
A shorter version of the standard URL, often used for sharing.
Used when the video is embedded in another website.
Sometimes seen when browsing YouTube on a mobile device.
Some browsers automatically add the www, but it's not strictly necessary.
Although YouTube will redirect to HTTPS, HTTP URLs are technically valid.
Sometimes seen when you're managing videos in YouTube Studio.
Sometimes YouTube URLs can be country-specific.
Used for sharing and includes the user who shared it.
